DOC.brief_title: Selective Internal Radiation Therapy ( SIRT ) Versus Transarterial Chemoembolisation ( TACE ) Treatment Hepatocellular Carcinoma ( HCC ) .
DOC.criteria: ≥18 year HCC , proven histology accord EASL criterion Intermediate stage HCC ( stage B accord BCLC ) At least one measurable lesion magnetic resonance imaging ( MRI ) Tumor load ≤ 50 % preserve liver function ( Child Pugh A B ) Patients feasible curative treatment ( e.g . resection local ablation ) Previous TACE SIRT Chemotherapy last 4 week Child Pugh stage C BCLC stage D ECOG Performance Status > 0 Tumor involvement > 50 % liver Extrahepatic tumor Serum Bilirubin > 2.0 mg/dl ; Serum Albumin 2.8 g/dl , Serum Creatinine > 2 mg/dl ; Leukocytes < 3000/ml ; Thrombocytes < 50000/ml Clinically apparent ascites ( ascites CT/MRI exclusion criterion ) Esophageal bleed last 3 month Hepatic encephalopathy Transjugular intrahepatic portosystemic shunt ( TIPS ) Infiltration occlusion portal vein Hepatofugal blood flow portal vein Hepatopulmonary shunt ≥ 20 % macroaggregated albumin scan Contraindications angiography Gravidity
